In these Regulations – 

“Annual Conference” has the same meaning as it has in the Regulations of 1987; 

“Association” means the Association of Garda Superintendents; 

“Regulations of 1987” means Garda Síochána (Associations) (Superintendents 
and Chief Superintendents) Regulations 1987 (S.I. No. 200 of 1987); 

“Special Conference” has the same meaning as it has in the Regulations of 1987. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in

title: Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 452 of 2020)) and section 59(2) of the
heading: 3. (1) A relevant conference need not be held at a physical venue but may
text_raw:
3. (1) A relevant conference need not be held at a physical venue but may 
be conducted wholly or partly by the use of electronic communications 
technology so long as all attendees have a reasonable opportunity to participate 
in the conference in accordance with this Regulation. 

(2) 

(a) Provision may be made by the Association for participation in a 
relevant conference by the use of electronic communications 
technology, including for a mechanism for casting votes, whether 
before or during the conference. 

(b) The mechanism referred to in paragraph (a) shall not require the 
person casting the vote to be physically present at a relevant 
conference or require that person to appoint a proxy who is to be 
physically present at the conference. 

(3) Any temporary failure or disruption of electronic communications 
technology shall not invalidate a relevant conference merely by virtue of that 
temporary failure or disruption. 

(4) In this Regulation – 

“attendee”, in relation to a relevant conference, means any member of an area 
committee (within the meaning of the Regulations of 1987) attending the 
conference or any other person invited by such an area committee or the National 
Executive Committee (within the meaning of those Regulations) to attend the 
conference; 

“electronic communications technology”, in relation to a relevant conference, 
means technology that enables real-time transmission and real-time two-way 
audio or audio-visual communication enabling attendees to participate in the 
conference using such technology from a remote location; 

“relevant conference” means any of the following conferences of the Association 
in the year 2021: 

(a) 

(b) 

the Annual Conference; 

a Special Conference. 

Annual Conference for the year 2020
